intro: Haplophyllum griffithianum, commonly known as the Himalayan moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique blooming habit and ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
